Göritz befindet sich im Ruhestand und ist nur noch gelegentlich anwesend. Herr Prof. Dr. S. Kreitmeier ist für das Schutzrechte-Management der Universität Regensburg zuständig. How-To? About pass-through How-To? About pass-through How-To? About pass-through LINUX | 1. open a terminal 2. type "cd /temp/grw25276" this is the folder where you can easily ? have access to the pictures of our group about the Kanu-trip along the Naab river ? copy some files, to be downloaded from another location (especially those that are quite large) 3. remind to CANCEL those files you copied in, if you aren't any more interested in or they are not of public domain! 4. type "logout" WINDOWS | 1. open SSH* 2) press space bar or enter 3) fill hostname & username as follows: 4) press Connect 5) insert your own Password 6) you are inside your folder! 7) press the yellow icon as shown in the lower picture: 8) now there appears a new window, like the one below, and one must fill the field marked with an arrow with ?/temp/grw25276?, as shown 9) now you have two columns, in the left side you can easily find the files you want to transfer and in the right side you have already selected the folder you want to copy your files into 10) from the Menu above, open Edit and select Copy 11) the transfer is done! 12) be happy: now you can access that folder from remote and copy the files back! ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ *In case you haven't got it, download it from RZ Setup: a) open RZ Setup (usually in Startup Menu, or at least within the list of installed Programs) b) in the first menu, click on the down-arrow and select "All Categories" and scroll down what appears in the area below c) look for the latest version of "SSH Secure Shell Client", select it and choose "Install" among the buttons below d) launch SSH (you can either find it in Startup Menu under the voice Programs or search it via your hard disk) ??????????????????????????????????????? ??????????????????????????????????????? All the best from your system manager?

About pass-through LINUX | 1. open a terminal 2. type "cd /temp/grw25276" this is the folder where you can easily ? have access to the pictures of our group about the Kanu-trip along the Naab river ? copy some files, to be downloaded from another location (especially those that are quite large) 3. remind to CANCEL those files you copied in, if you aren't any more interested in or they are not of public domain! 4. type "logout" WINDOWS | 1. open SSH* 2) press space bar or enter 3) fill hostname & username as follows: 4) press Connect 5) insert your own Password 6) you are inside your folder! 7) press the yellow icon as shown in the lower picture: 8) now there appears a new window, like the one below, and one must fill the field marked with an arrow with ?/temp/grw25276?, as shown 9) now you have two columns, in the left side you can easily find the files you want to transfer and in the right side you have already selected the folder you want to copy your files into 10) from the Menu above, open Edit and select Copy 11) the transfer is done! 12) be happy: now you can access that folder from remote and copy the files back! ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ *In case you haven't got it, download it from RZ Setup: a) open RZ Setup (usually in Startup Menu, or at least within the list of installed Programs) b) in the first menu, click on the down-arrow and select "All Categories" and scroll down what appears in the area below c) look for the latest version of "SSH Secure Shell Client", select it and choose "Install" among the buttons below d) launch SSH (you can either find it in Startup Menu under the voice Programs or search it via your hard disk) ??????????????????????????????????????? ??????????????????????????????????????? All the best from your system manager?

Quantum Transport and Spintronics – find us Quantum Transport and Spintronics – find us How to reach us by car Coming from Munich: Follow Autobahn A9 to Dreieck Holledau, then follow A93 to Regensburg. At the Autobahn-junction Regensburg follow A3 direction Passau to Exit 100a "Regensburg-Klinikum/-Universität". Coming from Frankfurt/Würzburg: Follow Autobahn A9 to the Autobahn-junction Nürnberg, then follow A3 to Regensburg, Exit 100a "Regensburg-Klinikum/-Universität" Coming from Leipzig: Follow Autobahn A9 to the Autobahn-junction Nürnberg, then follow A3 to Regensburg, Exit 100a "Regensburg-Klinikum/-Universität" Coming from Passau: Follow Autobahn A3 to the Exit 100a "Regensburg-Klinikum/-Universität" From the Exit follow the signs "Universität/Klinikum". There will be parking opportunities in the subterranean garage of the university. See this sketch of the Autobahn-junctions around Regensburg. Maybe this route finder is useful to you.

Quantum Transport and Spintronics – find us Quantum Transport and Spintronics – find us How to reach us by plane The largest airport close to Regensburg is Airport "Franz-Josef-Strauß", Munich Take bus number 635 to Freising (appr. 15 min) from there take the train to Regensburg main station (appr. 1 hour). The transfer takes appr. 1,5 hours (depending on the connections) and the added price is around EUR 16,--. FlugHaSe in Regensburg (Phone +49 (0)700 246 246 246) offers a shuttle service to Regensburg, which is more comfortable. They do have English-speaking staff, so do not be afraid to call them. You should contact FlugHaSe two weeks before your arrival. The price ranges between EUR 49,-- (one passenger) and EUR 17,-- (8 passengers). The chauffeur service Rent-a-Comfort offers an individual promt service. The price for one car depends on the number of passengers: 1-2 passenger(s): EUR 87,--, 3-4 passengers: EUR 97,--, 5 passengers: EUR 107,00 There are extra fees for long delay times and special services. Phone (Mo-Fr 9:30 a.m. to 12:00 a.m.): +49 (0)941 567 44 90. The airport Nuremberg ist much smaller but as close as the airport in Munich. From there take the subway U2 to Nuremberg main train station (appr. 15 min) and then take the train to Regensburg (appr. 1 hour). Price: between EUR 15,-- and EUR 20.--.

Quantum Transport and Spintronics – find us Quantum Transport and Spintronics – find us How to reach us by train The university is located at the south end of Regensburg within walking distance (appr. 30 min) of the city centre and can be easily reached by bus (10 min, see below.) It is possible to get from the train station (see the time table of the Deutsche Bahn AG) to the university either by bus line number 6 (direction Klinikum) or 11 (direction Burgweinting). The distance from the train station to the bus terminal "Bustreff Albertstrasse" (see map) is appr. 100 m. Both lines leave the bus terminal at a stop located around the corner at the east end (turn right coming from the train station) of the terminal. Get off at the stop Universität/Mensa. Our institute is marked with a red spot on the campus map. Coming from the bus stop you will reach the physics building by walking through the mathematics building. Busses leave in both directions between 5.30 a.m. and 11:50 p.m. normally every 20 minutes, number 6 at busy times (in the morning and late afternoon) every 10 minutes.

Webmaster Impressum - Legal Notice Dies hier ist das offizielle Webangebot der Arbeitsgruppen von Prof. Dr. Vladimir Braun und Prof. Dr. Andreas Schäfer an der Fakultät für Physik der Universität Regensburg. Die Anbieterinformationen entsprechend der einschlägigen rechtlichen Vorschriften finden Sie im Impressum der Universität Regensburg. Technisch gesehen handelt es sich um einen virtuellen Server auf dem zentralen Webserver der Universität. Dieser Webserver wird betrieben vom Rechenzentrum der Universität. Haftungsausschluss und Privacy Policy des Rechenzentrums gelten entsprechend auch für die Webseiten der Fakultät für Physik und damit auch für diese Seiten. Programmierung: Martin Hetzenegger, Bernhard Mendl Design: Franz Stadler These are the official pages of the research groups of Vladimir Braun and Andreas Schäfer of the faculty of physics at the university of Regensburg. The provider information according to the appropriate German law is available in the imprint of the University of Regensburg. Technically speaking this is a virtual instance of the central Webserver from the university. This Server is operated by the Computer Center of the university. Therefore nonliability and privacy policy of the Computer Center are also in force for the website of the Faculty of Physics and of this site. Coding: Martin Hetzenegger, Bernhard Mendl Design: Franz Stadler Legal Notice Last modified: 30 th Apr, 2009 by Webmaster

Für alle Teilnehmer ist eine Anmeldung erforderlich. Klausureinsicht vom 21. - 25.10. jeweils 8.30 - 12.00 im Sekretariat von Prof. Huber. Klausur: Montag, 08.07.13, 10 - 12 Uhr, Hörsaal H36 Vorläufige Klausurergebnisse Klausureinsicht bis 26.07.2012 nach Terminabsprache mit Frau Franzke (E-Mail: ulla.franzkeur.de). Vorlesung: montags 10 - 12 Uhr (Raum H36) und mittwochs 10 - 12 Uhr (Raum H34) Übungen: (Einteilung der Übungsgruppen) Gruppe 1: montags, 15 ? 17 Uhr, Phy 7.1.21 (Betreuer: Max Eisele) Gruppe 2: dienstags 8 ? 10 Uhr, Phy 7.1.21 (Betreuer: Matthias Hohenleutner) Gruppe 3: dienstags 8 ? 10 Uhr, Phy 9.1.08 (Betreuer: Christoph Lange) Gruppe 4: dienstags 13 ? 15 Uhr, Phy 9.1.10 (Betreuer: Olaf Schubert) Gruppe 5: mittwochs 8 ? 10 Uhr, Phy 7.1.21 (Betreuer: Christoph Pöllmann) Gruppe 6: mittwochs 13 ? 15 Uhr, Phy 9.1.09 (Betreuer: Thomas Maag) Gruppe 7: mittwochs 15 ? 17 Uhr, Phy 9.1.10 (Betreuer: Michael Porer) Tafelanschrieb: - nicht verfügbar - Übungsblätter - nicht verfügbar - Last modified: 23.07.2013 by Webmaster
